trans-unit.source: The Azure Marketplace makes available a wide range of popular web apps developed by Microsoft, third party companies, and open source software initiatives.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Marketplace makes available a wide range of popular web apps developed by Microsoft, third party companies, and open source software initiatives.

trans-unit.source: Web apps created from the Azure Marketplace do not require installation of any software other than the browser used to connect to the [Azure Preview Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715).
trans-unit.target: Web apps created from the Azure Marketplace do not require installation of any software other than the browser used to connect to the [Azure Preview Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715).

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you'll learn:
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you'll learn:

trans-unit.source: How to create a new web app through the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: How to create a new web app through the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: How to deploy the web app through the Azure Preview Portal.
trans-unit.target: How to deploy the web app through the Azure Preview Portal.

trans-unit.source: You'll build a WordPress blog that uses a default template.
trans-unit.target: You'll build a WordPress blog that uses a default template.

trans-unit.source: The following illustration shows the completed application:
trans-unit.target: The following illustration shows the completed application:

trans-unit.source: Wordpress blog
trans-unit.target: Wordpress blog

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Create a web app in the portal
trans-unit.target: Create a web app in the portal

trans-unit.source: Log in to the Azure Preview Portal.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the Azure Preview Portal.

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure Marketplace either by clicking the **Marketplace** icon:
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure Marketplace either by clicking the **Marketplace** icon:

trans-unit.source: Marketplace icon
trans-unit.target: Marketplace icon

trans-unit.source: Or by clicking the **New** icon on the upper right of the dashboard, and selecting **Marketplace** at the bottow of the list.
trans-unit.target: Or by clicking the **New** icon on the upper right of the dashboard, and selecting **Marketplace** at the bottow of the list.

trans-unit.source: Create New
trans-unit.target: Create New

trans-unit.source: Select **Web + Mobile**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Web + Mobile**.

trans-unit.source: Search for **WordPress** and click the **WordPress** icon.
trans-unit.target: Search for **WordPress** and click the **WordPress** icon.

trans-unit.source: WordPress from list
trans-unit.target: WordPress from list

trans-unit.source: After reading the description of the WordPress app, select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: After reading the description of the WordPress app, select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Web app**, and provide the required values for configuring your web app.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Web app**, and provide the required values for configuring your web app.

trans-unit.source: configure your app
trans-unit.target: configure your app

trans-unit.source: Click on **Database**, and provide the required values for configuring your MySQL database.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Database**, and provide the required values for configuring your MySQL database.

trans-unit.source: configure database
trans-unit.target: configure database

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Set resource group
trans-unit.target: Set resource group

trans-unit.source: If necessary, click **SUBSCRIPTION**, and specify the subscription to use.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, click **SUBSCRIPTION**, and specify the subscription to use.

trans-unit.source: When you have finished defining the web app, click **Create**, and wait while the new web app is created.
trans-unit.target: When you have finished defining the web app, click **Create**, and wait while the new web app is created.

trans-unit.source: When the app has been created, you will see the resource group containing web app and database.
trans-unit.target: When the app has been created, you will see the resource group containing web app and database.

trans-unit.source: show group
trans-unit.target: show group

trans-unit.source: Launch and manage your WordPress web app
trans-unit.target: Launch and manage your WordPress web app

trans-unit.source: Click on your new web app to see details about your app.
trans-unit.target: Click on your new web app to see details about your app.

trans-unit.source: launch dashboard
trans-unit.target: launch dashboard

trans-unit.source: On the **Essentials** page, click either **Browse** or the link under **Url** to open the web app's welcome page.
trans-unit.target: On the **Essentials** page, click either **Browse** or the link under **Url** to open the web app's welcome page.

trans-unit.source: site URL
trans-unit.target: site URL

trans-unit.source: If you have not installed WordPress, enter the appropriate configuration information required by WordPress and click **Install WordPress** to finalize configuration and open the web app's login page.
trans-unit.target: If you have not installed WordPress, enter the appropriate configuration information required by WordPress and click **Install WordPress** to finalize configuration and open the web app's login page.

trans-unit.source: Click **Login** and enter your credentials.
trans-unit.target: Click **Login** and enter your credentials.

trans-unit.source: You'll have a new WordPress web app that looks similar to the web app below.
trans-unit.target: You'll have a new WordPress web app that looks similar to the web app below.

trans-unit.source: your WordPress site
trans-unit.target: your WordPress site
